body:
asm 6.2 alone does not fix this, neither does upgrading to latest bytebuddy help here.
The combination of asm 6.2, latest bytebuddy, a minor code change in mockito and setting `-Dnet.bytebuddy.experimental=true` helps here.

issue.title: mockito on Java 11-ea+21

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body:
Fixes #1419 

Requires `-Dnet.bytebuddy.experimental=true` system property to be set to let bytebuddy use asm API version `ASM7_EXPERMIENTAL` and use the same one in `InlineBytecodeGenerator`.

issue.title: Java 11: UnsupportedOperationException at ClassVisitor.visitNestMemberExperimental

repository.name: byte-buddy
repository.description: Runtime code generation for the Java virtual machine.

issue.body:
Hej,

when trying out the latest Java 11 EA build, some of the tests of the Elastic APM Java agent fail. Could this be related to the recent changes related to the nest-based access control?

```
$ java -version
openjdk version "11-ea" 2018-09-25
OpenJDK Runtime Environment 18.9 (build 11-ea+21)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 18.9 (build 11-ea+21, mixed mode)
```

	at com.intellij.rt.execution.junit.JUnitStarter.main(JUnitStarter.java:70)
```
</details>

You can reproduce that by checking out the agent (`git@github.com:elastic/apm-agent-java.git`), commenting out the jacoco plugin in `./pom.xml` (as it does not support Java 11 (probably due to the removal of `Unsafe#defineClass`)) and executing `mvn clean test`.

issue.title: Java 11 compatibility with inline mocks

repository.name: mockito
repository.description: Most popular Mocking framework for unit tests written in Java

issue.body: Java 11 compatibility was addressed under issue #1419, however with inline mocks (required to mock private/final classes) it is still not working. Please see comments under issue #1419.

issue.title: support for Java9+ (build and run)

milestone.title: release:3.1.0
milestone.description: Update with newer versions (spring-boot 2.1.x) and add support up to Java11

repository.name: devon4j
repository.description: devonfw Java stack - create enterprise-grade business apps in Java safe and fast

issue.body:
I have tried the build with the new released jdk 11. This resulted in a new error, compared to the successful build with jdk10.

issue.title: Mockito support issues on Java 10 & 11

labels.name: Category: Build/CI
labels.description: Requests, Issues and Changes targeting gradle, groovy, Jenkins, etc.

labels.name: Blocker
labels.description: Issue reporting or PR addressing a critical problem that blocks other efforts

labels.name: Type: Improvement
labels.description: Request for or addition/enhancement of a feature

issue.body:
### What you were trying to do

Run all unit tests in the `engine-tests` project with Java 10 on a Mac

### What actually happened

About 200 tests failed, seemingly with well-known Mockito compatibility issues on newer Javas. See for instance https://github.com/mockito/mockito/issues/1419

I suspect we might just have to keep an eye on this but in the meantime could probably try to update to the very latest Mockito anyway so long as it doesn't break anything (at least on Java 8)

### How to reproduce

* Run the engine unit test with Java 10 or 11
* Try varying the version of Mockito in the `build.gradle file in `engine-tests` to `2.23.0` - for me that cuts it down to about 6 broken tests, still at least some are Mockito related  

### Computer details

* MacOS Mojave update 10.14
* Java 10.0.1+10

```

@cstroe Are you sure that you don't have some older byte-buddy version on the classpath?

(of course I assume that use you the latest version of Mockito and Byte Buddy provided by it).

Great to hear.

Btw, Spring Boot provides also an easier way to override dependency [versions](https://docs.spring.io/platform/docs/Cairo-BUILD-SNAPSHOT/reference/html/getting-started-overriding-versions.html). Here, overriding Mockito would be enough.

Btw, AFAIR only Spring Boot 2.1 declared Java 11 compatibility. Therefore, you may want to upgrade to prevent further surprises :).

issue.title: Unit tests fails with JDK11
issue.body:
`org.mockito.exceptions.base.MockitoException: 
Mockito cannot mock this class: interface org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.ReaderPlugin.

Mockito can only mock non-private & non-final classes.
If you're not sure why you're getting this error, please report to the mailing list.


Java               : 11
JVM vendor name    : Oracle Corporation
JVM vendor version : 11.0.1+13-LTS
JVM name           : Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM
JVM version        : 11.0.1+13-LTS
JVM info           : mixed mode
OS name            : Windows 10
OS version         : 10.0
`

seems to be explained and solved here:
https://github.com/mockito/mockito/issues/1419

The solution is to upgrade mockito to a recent version.
Verified working with version 2.23.4

body:
> 
> 
> > testCompile('org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-test') {
> > exclude group: "org.mockito", module: "mockito-core"
> > }
> > testCompile("org.mockito:mockito-core:2.23.4")
> 
> this works like a charm, Thank You!

Anyone has an idea how to do this in pom.xml?

@bric3 I did exactly the same, still didn't help :-(

> Java               : 11
> JVM vendor name    : Oracle Corporation
> JVM vendor version : 11.0.2+9
> JVM name           : OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM
> JVM version        : 11.0.2+9
> JVM info           : mixed mode
> OS name            : Mac OS X
> OS version         : 10.14.4
